title: Violent flower shop owner shot in his driveway before chasing his attacker down the road
text:
Violent flower shop owner shot in his driveway before chasing his attacker down the road Shooting victim Ross Craig previously fled the country to avoid jail for slashing two men Share Ross Craig was last night being comforted by his Polish fiancée Anna Handzel, 33, after being shot in his driveway (Photo: Internet Unknown) Share Get daily   
A thug flower shop owner was shot in the leg in his driveway before trying to chase his attacker down the road. 
Police are treating the attack on Ross Craig as attempted murder after he suffered leg injuries during the shooting as he left his house about 8.30am yesterday. 
He saw the gunman standing at the bottom of his driveway in Glasgow and was shot once in the leg after going to investigate. 
Craig chased the gunman for several streets but he got away after jumping into a waiting car. Police at the scene in Glasgow yesterday (Photo: Daily Record) A Regal Roses van in the driveway (Photo: Daily Record) Forensics at the scene (Photo: Daily Record) 
Craig was last night being comforted by his Polish fiancée Anna Handzel, 33, after being released from Glasgow’s Queen Elizabeth University Hospital. 
Today it has emerged the 34-year-old, who owns Glasgow florists Regal Roses, previously fled the country to avoid jail for slashing two men, the Daily Record reports. 
Craig’s criminal past saw him jailed for six-and-a-half years in 2010 for the vicious attack in Glasgow city centre. Ross Craig and his partner Anna Handzel (Photo: Internet Unknown) Ross and Anna on holiday (Photo: Internet Unknown) 
The offences happened in 2006 – but Craig fled to Cyprus in an attempt to avoid justice. 
He was on bail when he attacked the men but was again freed on bail after his arrest. 
He didn't turn up for a court date in 2007 and was arrested on his return from Cyprus in March 2010, 
The High Court in Edinburgh heard his victims – a soldier and his friend – found a man in the street who was bleeding from a head injury. Ross and Anna on holiday (Photo: Internet Unknown) Anna was comforting Craig last night (Photo: Internet Unknown) 
Craig and a pal had just walked past and the two men suspected they were to blame and ended up in a fight. 
Craig pulled out a seven-inch knife and stabbed one man twice in the back and thigh and slashed his face. The other was also slashed and suffered chest wounds. 
It’s thought police are checking to see if there is a link between yesterday’s shooting and Craig’s violent past. 
Craig set up swanky florist Regal Roses in January with Anna. 
A van bearing their logo was parked in the drive of his house in Shawhill Road, Shawlands, where the shooting took place. Police at St Ronans Drive, Glasgow, in response to a shooting incident in Shawhill Road (Photo: Daily Record) The Regal Roses van in driveway (Photo: Daily Record) 
Craig chased the man down Shawhill Road then right into Hector Road, along Pollokshaws Road and on to St Ronan’s Drive, where a dark-coloured car was waiting. 
The 5ft 7in gunman, who wore dark clothes and a dark beanie hat, got into the passenger side. The car turned right into Woodstock Avenue or Peveril Avenue. 
Forensics officers were still searching the area late last night. Read More Gangland slasher jailed for knifing notorious drugs baron in revenge attack in front of horrified shoppers 
Several attempts were made yesterday to contact Craig and Anna but they were unavailable. 
A phone at Regal Roses was answered by a Polish-sounding woman who said: “I don’t think I should be talking about this.” 
Detective Inspector Colin Hailstones, of Cathcart CID, said: “I know locals will be concerned by this incident. 
“We understand that this was a targeted and isolated attack. It is being treated as attempted murder. The Regal Roses van in the driveway (Photo: Daily Record) 
'Specialist officers will be working in the area and we are conducting door-to-door inquiries and assessing opportunities to capture CCTV. 
“We will not allow such a brazen act of violence to go unaccounted for.” 
He appealed for information. 
The shooting horrified residents and business owners. Laundry worker Jain Sudha, 40, said: “Shawlands Primary School is just down the road. It’s terrible to think this has happened here.” 
Hair stylist Teighan McNab, 22, said: “Police were in asking around to see if anyone had any CCTV footage.” Police at the scene (Photo: Daily Record) Forensics examined the property (Photo: Daily Record) Read More 
The attack happened about 150 yards from St Conval’s Primary School. The shooting follows several similar incidents in the city in recent months. 
In November, Euan Johnston, 26, was shot dead in a drive-by on Shields Road on the southside. 
Gangland figure Ross Monaghan, 35, was shot in the shoulder at the gates of St George’s Primary School in Penilee in January. 
Last month, thugs opened fire on the house of crime lord Jamie Daniel’s son Francis “Fraggle” Green in the north of the city in a mob feud. Like us on Facebook
